actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development.

actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.

actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 105-514.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 179.
Mr. Kim moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development

official_title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the seventeenth annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service.

summary.text: Permits the National Fraternal Order of Police and its auxiliary to sponsor a free, public event, the 17th annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service, on the Capitol grounds on May 15, 1998.

titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the seventeenth annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service.
